results.title: The Energy audit
results.creator_credit: Mark Poole, John Hipwell, Gas and Fuel Corporation of Victoria and Commonwealth Department of Primary Industries and Energy
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Energy management in commercial buildings”.
Designed as part of a series of videos outlining practical ways to measure energy use in commercial buildings, this video concentrates on conducting an energy audit. In turn, this will help the building manager in completing an energy management program with the aim of identifying opportunities for energy cost saving.

results.title: The Enemy within (2003) [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Eva Colmers, Jerry Krepakevich, Bonnie Thompson and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: In World War II thousands of German prisoners-of-war were sent to camps in Canada where they saw out the war, many for several years. This documentary examines the experiences of a few of those men, as well as presenting the perspectives of the Canadian guards. Filmmaker Eva Colmers (a German-born resident of Canada) focuses on the story of her father - a POW who has fond memories of his time in captivity. If this seems disingenuous, it is through a series of interviews that he reveals that he was well fed, well treated and educated during his confinement. Of interest here is also the workings of a POW camp — how the men strictly adhered to their rank and values as soldiers, even remaining loyal to Hitler. What is clear is that they were treated with respect that fostered loyalty, to the point where the prisoners were released to work on farms, and as lumberjacks, and were even allowed at times, to wander beyond the barbwire. Overall this is a fascinating tale that mixes interviews with archival footage, thus presenting a very humanistic slant on what was a cruel and murderous time in history.

results.title: The Enemy within
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Reel Australia”.
Snowy Baker, is a secret service agent called in to crack a ring of foreign agents involved in treason and civil violence in Australia. Jack’s sweetheart, Myee, is kidnapped by the villains, but after a long chase Jack is able to trap the enemy and rescue Myee.

results.title: The Enduring wilderness
results.creator_credit: Ernest Reid and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A scenic tour of Canada’s national parks, from the mountains of British Columbia to the seaswept shores of Newfoundland. Besides the beauty of the unspoiled wilderness (and there is much of that), you see also the farsightedness of those who in the past century, set aside these territories for the enjoyment of future generations.

results.title: The Endless summer
results.creator_credit: Bruce Brown and Bruce Brown Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Golden years of surf collection”.
The archetypal surfing film of the 1960’s, Bruce Brown defied all odds to produce one of the most successful feature-length documentary films in movie history. Filmed on locations world-wide, with diverting tongue-in- cheek narrative by Brown, we follow two surfers’ quest for the ultimate wave. The heady surfing days of the sixties are forever captured in this classic.

results.title: The End of violence
results.creator_credit: Wim Wenders, Nicholas Klein, Deepak Nayar, Kintop Pictures, Road Movies Filmproduktion and CiBy 2000
results.brief_description:
A film about conspiracy, the effects of violence in our culture, and personal transformation. Mike Max is a leading Hollywood producer, whose triumph has come from a string of extremely violent action films. His work is his life, and he neglects his wife in his pursuit of success. Frustrated with his lack of attention, she leaves him, and Max is forced to admit he was a less-than supportive husband. Not long after, he becomes involved in a violent killing, and fearing for his life, goes into hiding, falling victim to a new top-secret surveillance system that caught the crime on camera. Escaping into L.A.’s underworld, Max confronts violence more terrifying than anything he could put on film.

Credits: Producers, Deepak Nayer, Nicholas Klein ; director, Wim Wenders ; writer, Nicholas Klein ; photography, Pascal Rabaud ; music, Ry Cooder ; editing, Peter Pryzygodda.
Cast: Bill Pullman, Andie MacDowell, Traci Lind, Rosalind Chao, K. Todd Freeman, Gabriel Byrne.

results.title: The End of violence
results.creator_credit: Wim Wenders, Nicholas Klein, Deepak Nayar, Kintop Pictures, Road Movies and Ciby Pictures
results.brief_description: Mike Max (Bill Pullman) is a leading Hollywood producer, whose triumph has come from a string of extremely violent action films. His work is his life, and he neglects his wife Paige (Andie MacDowell) in his pursuit of success. Paige, frustrated with his lack of attention, leaves him, and Max is forced to admit he was a less-than supportive husband. Not long after, Max becomes involved in a violent killing, and fearing for his life, goes into hiding, falling victim to a new top-secret surveillance system, which caught the crime on camera. Escaping into L.A.’s underworld, Max confronts a violence more terrifying than anything he could put on film. Directed by Wim Wenders (Wings of desire; Faraway so close; Paris, Texas) ‘The End of Violence’ is a tale of conspiracy, the effects of violence in our culture, and personal transformation. Cast includes Traci Lind, Rosiland Chao, Gabriel Byrne, Udo Kier, Frederic Forrest and director Samuel Fuller. The film’s score was composed by Ry Cooder.

results.title: The End of the road
results.brief_description: Situated in the remotest part of Northern Alaska is the oil field of Prudo Bay. This film looks at the operations required to run this oil field and the harsh climatic conditions under which the workers carry out their specific tasks.
results.description: Situated in the remotest part of Northern Alaska is the oil field of Prudo Bay. This film looks at the operations required to run this oil field and the harsh climatic conditions under which the workers carry out their specific tasks.

results.title: The End of the rainbow = Das Lockende ziel
results.creator_credit: Max Reichmann, British Empire Films and Richard Tauber Tonfilm-Prod. GmbH
results.brief_description: A Bavarian love story featuring world renowned tenor Richard Tauber in the lead role with Sophie Pagay, Lucie Englisch, Oscar Sima, Karl Elzer, Marie Elsmer. Written by Walter Forster and Paul Horbiger. In German with occasional English captions.

results.title: The End of the Nancy J.
results.creator_credit: Bernard Devlin and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Bill Cluney’s fishing boat, the ”Nancy J”, is unsafe. Pleas by a marine engineer to make it safe are ignored. Then Bill becomes frightened by the local undertaker’s interest in him as a high death risk, and he begins to install safety equipment. But before the repairs are completed, Bill sets out to sea and the ”Nancy J” explodes. Cast includes: Stan Kane, James Barron, Donald Young and Len Watt
